quoteFirst: He was a well-set-up youngster and, in spite of the spills he had made during practice, carried himself like a ball player. The “fans” watched him and reserved judgment, asking each other how Steve had managed to get hold of him at less than a half-hour’s notice. For it had been
quoteLast: when the accident had happened that had sent three of the Badgers’ best players to the hospital, Bennett, as was learned later, with a broken leg, Morgan with three ribs caved in, and Pitcher Cotton with enough contusions to keep him out of the game for a week at least.
title: Second Base Sloan
author: Mathewson, Christy, 1880-1925; Caswell, Edward C., 1879-1963 [Illustrator]

quoteLast: ; I must go and get my traps. Whatever you do, don’t be late, Vaughan; I leave you to take charge of Campell, who never was in time in his life--not even for an Indian train.”
title: Proper pride
author: Croker, B. M. (Bithia Mary), 1849?-1920

quoteLast: . The car slowed down by the farm, in the yard of which Miss Avery was standing. Henry asked her whether a cab had gone past.
title: Howards End
author: Forster, E. M. (Edward Morgan), 1879-1970

quoteFirst: He walked slowly along the edge of the fountain, and then again looked at the church clock, which was two minutes faster than his watch. It was
quoteLast: . He thought that he would be more comfortable inside, and entered the church. The coolness of a cellar assailed him, he breathed it with pleasure, and then took a turn round the nave to reconnoiter the place.
title:
Bel Ami (A Ladies' Man)
The Works of Guy de Maupassant, Vol. 6
author: Maupassant, Guy de, 1850-1893

quoteLast: Mary and Jack awoke with a start from a dream fantasy, to find themselves breathing the ampler air of Park Lane. Even then they could not quite grasp the meaning of all that had happened.
title: The time spirit: A romantic tale
author: Snaith, J. C. (John Collis), 1876-1936

quoteFirst: As it is not likely to last long he'll be gone in a few moments. Have you the right time about you? What do you make it?
quoteLast: by post office time? The result ought to be here at any moment. Ah, I thought so. Just keep your eye closely upon Chaffey."
title: Hard Pressed
author: White, Fred M. (Fred Merrick), 1859-1935

quoteLast: , then," laughed Mother. "And, Molly, so that you won't forget this time, all the way to Miss Eleanor's, say over and over, 'Five minutes after three.' Then, just as soon as you get there, say the words quickly to Miss Eleanor, 'Five minutes after three.'"
title:

quoteLast: , getting uneasy at the delay, he took paper and pencil in his hand and asked where she was.

quoteFirst: The place: The kerb in front of the Criterion at Piccadilly Circus.  The time:
quoteLast: on a broiling afternoon in July.  As an idle lounger, apparently absorbed in contemplation of the ceaseless tide of human traffic that ebbed and flowed, I stood gazing along the famous London thoroughfare.  In truth, I was keenly alert to every movement about me, for I had extremely important Secret Service work in hand.
title: Sant of the Secret Service: Some Revelations of Spies and Spying
author: Le Queux, William, 1864-1927
